medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe hypertension and associated symptoms (headache and nausea) during pregnancy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at 12 weeks of gestation. At 16 weeks, blood pressure was slightly elevated. By 17 weeks, blood pressure increased to approximately 160/110 mmHg. An unplanned visit at 18 weeks and 4 days showed blood pressure at 198/110 mmHg, worsening to 172/116 mmHg on admission. Symptoms progressed with severe hypertension alongside headache and nausea. After medical intervention, the patient's blood pressure and proteinuria returned to normal at 2 weeks postpartum.
